AU: Ando, H
AF: Ando, Hiroyasu
TI: Critical-Level Crossing of Rossby-Gravity Wave-Packets in a Linear-Shear, Stratified Flow
DE: Couette flow; wave-packet; critical level; normal mode
AB: The propagation of Rossby-gravity waves, which are of astronomical interest near the critical level (or corotation point), is considered in a linear-shear, exponentially stratilied flow by means of a ray tracing method. It is shown, using the analytic solutions for the stream function, that for a Richardson number. J>1/4 a wave-packet can cross the critical level in a finite time. In the unstable stratified case (J<0), it cannot cross the critical level for large vertical bar J vertical bar (J<0), but may do so for some intermediate vertical bar J vertical bar values. Based on the above results, the possible existence of the regular normal mode with a discrete point eigenvalue in the continuous spectrum is discussed for bounded systems.
